commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238

commit_message:
fix(yaml): correct bad annotations

In a recent apparmor security patch [0], additional annotations were
added to the cronjobs that were incorrectly indented. While helm v2
seems fairly tolerant and ignores these errors, running this usig helm
v3 seems to cause rendering problems as we are placing incorrect key
and value pair into the spec: field. This patch set corrects this.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/725727/8

Change-Id: I9aae94bc0a68318b2c16fedbc973f7a0a2a3729e
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Use force OPTIONS to install the jq

when the force is yes, get_url moudel will download the file
every time and replace the file if the contents change, so it's
not necessary to remove the jq before get it.

Change-Id: I7337afecd1f9d7c66da46bff433016a39fd9ef7a

commit_message:
Monkey patch original current_thread _active

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Change-Id: I8c2ffea3c31b3009c87455d9c54dc233367f0d3d
Closes-Bug: #1863021
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/46/725346/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active # global variable. See https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1863021 and # https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592 import __original_module_threading as orig_threading import threading # noqa orig_threading.current_thread.__globals__['_active'] = threading._active

subject: Ensure OAuth1 authorized roles are respected
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-06 22:37:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/3793663458106279a6a0098edc11fabe38240b9a', 'message': 'Ensure OAuth1 authorized roles are respected

Without this patch, when an OAuth1 request token is authorized with a
limited set of roles, the roles for the access token are ignored when
the user uses it to request a keystone token. This means that user of an
access token can use it to escallate their role assignments beyond what
was authorized by the creator. This patch fixes the issue by ensuring
the token model accounts for an OAuth1-scoped token and correctly
populating the roles for it.

Modified to work with older test helper function:

  keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_oauth1.py

Change-Id: I02f9836fbd4d7e629653977fc341476cfd89859e
Closes-bug: #1873290

(cherry picked from commit 2483a578a80a916d9f5acd672d85830385b236e2)
(cherry picked from commit 10bc689a6796f85c44d19e0c18f0e37b0a87474c)
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-05-07 05:08:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/89ce7e48c1070070a7a2d7e72825f8e615de5a9a', 'message': 'Ensure OAuth1 authorized roles are respected

Without this patch, when an OAuth1 request token is authorized with a
limited set of roles, the roles for the access token are ignored when
the user uses it to request a keystone token. This means that user of an
access token can use it to escallate their role assignments beyond what
was authorized by the creator. This patch fixes the issue by ensuring
the token model accounts for an OAuth1-scoped token and correctly
populating the roles for it.

Modified to work with older test helper function:

  keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_oauth1.py

commit_message:
Ensure OAuth1 authorized roles are respected

Without this patch, when an OAuth1 request token is authorized with a
limited set of roles, the roles for the access token are ignored when
the user uses it to request a keystone token. This means that user of an
access token can use it to escallate their role assignments beyond what
was authorized by the creator. This patch fixes the issue by ensuring
the token model accounts for an OAuth1-scoped token and correctly
populating the roles for it.

Modified to work with older test helper function:

  keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_oauth1.py

Conflicts:

  keystone/models/token_model.py

  The keystone token model was refactored in the Rocky release. This
  commit only backports the test so that we have test coverage against
  the bug and proves there wasn't a regression in Queens. As such, the
  code changes to token_model.py (where the bug was introduced) are not
  applicable to Pike.

  releasenotes/notes/bug-1873290-ff7f8e4cee15b75a.yaml

  Removed the release note since there isn't anything to signal to
  operators regarding a vulnerability. We're only adding test coverage
  to prove that stable/queens isn't vulnerable.

Change-Id: I02f9836fbd4d7e629653977fc341476cfd89859e
Closes-bug: #1873290
(cherry picked from commit 6c73690f779a42a5c62914b6bc37f0ac2f41a3e3)

added_lines: --- security: - | [`bug 1873290 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1873290>`_] [`bug 1872735 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1872735>`_] Fixed the token model to respect the roles authorized OAuth1 access tokens. Previously, the list of roles authorized for an OAuth1 access token were ignored, so when an access token was used to request a keystone token, the keystone token would contain every role assignment the creator had for the project. This also fixed EC2 credentials to respect those roles as well. fixes: - | [`bug 1873290 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1873290>`_] [`bug 1872735 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1872735>`_] Fixed the token model to respect the roles authorized OAuth1 access tokens. Previously, the list of roles authorized for an OAuth1 access token were ignored, so when an access token was used to request a keystone token, the keystone token would contain every role assignment the creator had for the project. This also fixed EC2 credentials to respect those roles as well.

We need this version for non-x86 builds as 3.12.1 has only x86 binary
wheels.

commit_message:
Switch to new grenade job name

The integrated gate template (integrated-gate-py3) has been switched
to the new grenade name (grenade-py3 -> grenade). This repo uses the
template but also has for irrelevant files an extra entry.

Rename the job following the template change to avoid duplicate
grenade runs.

Details:
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014602.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/725148
Change-Id: I52ebbcae0d77c0420848a37babc73bb75dd58e0b
(cherry picked from commit 2b4e53792d75bc02a47b0caf2b53d3cb55b53737)

commit_message:
Remove inject_file from compute manager and virt driver

The inject_file call was removed from the compute RPC at 3.18.
As we have RCP 5.x now it is safe to remove the manager method
handing that call. This removes the last user of the inject_file virt
diver method so that is deleted too.

Change-Id: If257fa301e8c12bb0c5e4d396ccc2c7277b25233

commit_message:
Remove unused object_compat decorator

Deletes dead code and the related unit tests

deleted_lines: # TODO(danms): Remove me after Icehouse # TODO(alaski): Actually remove this after Newton, assuming a major RPC bump # NOTE(mikal): if the method being decorated has more than one decorator, then # put this one first. Otherwise the various exception handling decorators do # not function correctly. def object_compat(function): """Wraps a method that expects a new-world instance This provides compatibility for callers passing old-style dict instances. """ @functools.wraps(function) def decorated_function(self, context, *args, **kwargs): def _load_instance(instance_or_dict): if isinstance(instance_or_dict, dict): # try to get metadata and system_metadata for most cases but # only attempt to load those if the db instance already has # those fields joined metas = [meta for meta in ('metadata', 'system_metadata') if meta in instance_or_dict] instance = objects.Instance._from_db_object( context, objects.Instance(), instance_or_dict, expected_attrs=metas) instance._context = context return instance return instance_or_dict try: kwargs['instance'] = _load_instance(kwargs['instance']) except KeyError: args = (_load_instance(args[0]),) + args[1:] migration = kwargs.get('migration') if isinstance(migration, dict): migration = objects.Migration._from_db_object( context.elevated(), objects.Migration(), migration) kwargs['migration'] = migration return function(self, context, *args, **kwargs) return decorated_function

commit_message:
Fix system ca bundle for the correct python version

When the default python3 version is being overridden by e.g. setting

PYTHON3_VERSION=3.7

we need to fix the correct ca bundle, not the one for the default
python3 installation, which e.g. on Ubuntu 18.04 will be python3.6.

Change-Id: I25dbcdc56b4390eebc731a192d108674e2b8c625
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/88/673288/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix for auth during live-migration (2)

Post step could fail due to auth token expiration.
setup_networks_on_host fails with authentication required,
because there are some calls to neutron api using token
from request context. This patch change that calls to use
admin context.

Corresponding-patch:
Review - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/407147/
Commit - 4a5ecf1e29c3bdbb022f98a5fba41d4e7df56d88

Change-Id: I4d83a70c01f7ba943daa85c3777376380594b3f7
Closes-bug: #1647451

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in test/unit/common tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(x in y) to assertIn(x, y).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail

Change-Id: I3aef5fe9776eb6b4a6a3f28d17813253684bee61
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/92/476492/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(xyz is None) to assertIsNone(xyz).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: I61d3b294cc74546f03578ca1942434fa3024c89b

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-06-02 12:34:31.000000000', 'files': ['doc/requirements.txt', 'releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder/commit/08aad8ac0ec6d7dd4b5ea62cc70ed1a169ae72db', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I25dd42f39618163dff6a8d541017a9eb80adafd2
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I25dd42f39618163dff6a8d541017a9eb80adafd2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/71/732571/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

This patch is to simply abort instance creation directly from
image if container_format of the image is 'compressed'.
Error number 400 will be thrown while creating or rebuilding a
server with image in 'compressed' format.

Functional test for this patch included.

To support cinder patch [0, 1]:
[0] spec: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652275
[1] code: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668825
To support glance patch [2]:
[2] spec-lite: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670454

Change-Id: I3d1b174718d0c10d7e70de2bb0ceb6678e97f7ca

commit_message:
Check container_format on instance creation

Currently nova doesn't support new container format
'compressed'. And if we're trying to create a new instance
directly from a image which is in 'compressed' container
format, creation will be done successfully. However this
instance is not really valid.

This patch is to simply abort instance creation directly from
image if container_format of the image is 'compressed'.
Error number 400 will be thrown while creating or rebuilding a
server with image in 'compressed' format.

Functional test for this patch included.

To support cinder patch [0, 1]:
[0] spec: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652275
[1] code: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668825
To support glance patch [2]:
[2] spec-lite: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670454

Change-Id: I3d1b174718d0c10d7e70de2bb0ceb6678e97f7ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/07/673407/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if(instance['system_metadata']['image_container_format'] == 'compressed'): raise exception.ImageUnacceptable( image_id=instance['system_metadata']['image_base_image_ref'], reason=_("container_format:%(fmt)s is not supported in nova") % {'fmt': instance['system_metadata']['image_container_format']})

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I350ff814a1040403b3ff633e63d718f6af5b31b5

Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using

* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used

lead to some strange rendering.

during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I953c3393b32a48b1846d4bcb0159c1e3d5806beb

Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I018d5c366b54a3636e10e92b7fe7f2fd94b43f4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-vitrage refs/changes/14/732614/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Resume when image sanity fails

In non-periodic jobs do not fail when files are missing in the
overcloud image. Instead, display a warning message.

Fail only in periodic jobs as we don't want to promote bad images.

The missing files issue is still unkown.

Related-Bug: #1881090

Change-Id: I5a496f44aa36daaa609cdfb29ffe3a3eace7a41e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/23/731823/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Show warning if missing files debug: msg: "WARNING: One or more files are missing on the overcloud image." when: "item['rc'] == 1"
deleted_lines: - name: Fail if missing files found assert: that: - "item['rc'] == 1"

commit_message:
Ingress: Use latest controller image

Use nginx-ingress-controller:0.32.0 and change user to 101
intead of 33 which is suported by this image.

Change-Id: I38679e350ec352f13074055b7e08b98df1090fbf

lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: If0c72f4b5df2ac8983401a91e468d4e3863b2ba5
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: If0c72f4b5df2ac8983401a91e468d4e3863b2ba5

commit_message:
Fix the smoke test bundle

* remove resources from the smoke test bundle
  * attach_saml_resources step in Zaza does it https://git.io/JfKTp
* use the same set of applications in the smoke bundle so that configure
  steps and func tests pass.

Change-Id: Ic5c7bbb479197b7bc7161c2cd6090984901fa2b6
Closes-Bug: #1881267

commit_message:
hacking: Modify checks for translated logs

The N319 check previously asserted that debug-level logs were not
translated. Now that we've removed all log translations, we can
generalize this to all logs. We reuse the same number since these
numbers are really just metadata and not public contracts.

This also allows us to update the N323 and N326 checks, which ensure we
import the translation function, '_', wherever it's used and don't
concatenate translated and non-translated strings. Since we're no longer
translating logs and the '_LE', '_LW' and '_LI' symbols are no longer
provided, we don't need to consider logs in either of these cases.

Change-Id: I64d139ad660bc382e8b9d7c8cd03352b26aadafd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
docs: Remove subtitles, metadata from man pages

These do not render correctly when generating man pages and likely exist
from a time when the pages were built with rst2man (i.e. docutils)
instead of Sphinx. They're not necessary when using Sphinx since that
information is provided via the 'man_pages' config option in 'conf.py',
which are updated here to reflect reality.

Change-Id: I133e7231112cc9025e57a29d43bfa7002ca775e7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow {{network.name}}InterfaceDefaultRoute overriding by parameter

Currently {{network.name}}InterfaceDefaultRoute can be specified only
by network_data.yaml, and can't be oberridden by a template parameter.

This patch allows overriding the parameter by a template parameter, to
provide a consistent experience about network parameters in templates.

Change-Id: Iff5fdcc4007013c2794cd22e26f71aba8745a278

commit_message:
Release final python-magnumclient for ussuri

Final ussuri client lib release for the April 9 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: Ic12fd29b1258c794a09987fc18a322c618c5ef7e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Avoid unconditional fact gathering
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-31 15:22:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/ba4b3d536b4df0fb4ccb7de33073390026e5677c', 'message': "Avoid unconditional fact gathering

One way to improve the performance of Ansible is through fact caching.
Rather than gather facts in every play, we can configure Ansible to
cache them in a persistent store. An example Ansible configuration for
doing this is as follows:

[defaults]
gathering = smart
fact_caching = jsonfile
fact_caching_connection = ./facts
fact_caching_timeout = 86400

This does not affect Kolla Ansible however, since we use the setup
module which unconditionally gathers facts regardless of the state of
the cache. This gets worse with large inventories limited to a small
batch of hosts via --limit or serial, since the limited hosts must
gather facts for all others.

One way to detect whether facts exist for a host is via the
'module_setup' variable, which exists only when facts exist. This change
uses the 'module_setup' fact to determine whether facts need to be
gathered for hosts outside of the batch. For hosts in the batch, we
switch from using the setup module to gather_facts on the play, which
can use the 'smart' gathering logic.

Change-Id: I04841fb62b2e1d9e97ce4b75ce3a7349b9c74036
Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-04-02 12:39:58.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/avoid-unconditional-fact-gathering-94760984b2de0796.yaml', 'ansible/gather-facts.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/e0ba55a85d617c12f51be41c10778696ffc5004c', 'message': "Avoid unconditional fact gathering

One way to improve the performance of Ansible is through fact caching.
Rather than gather facts in every play, we can configure Ansible to
cache them in a persistent store. An example Ansible configuration for
doing this is as follows:

[defaults]
gathering = smart
fact_caching = jsonfile
fact_caching_connection = ./facts
fact_caching_timeout = 86400

This does not affect Kolla Ansible however, since we use the setup
module which unconditionally gathers facts regardless of the state of
the cache. This gets worse with large inventories limited to a small
batch of hosts via --limit or serial, since the limited hosts must
gather facts for all others.

One way to detect whether facts exist for a host is via the
'module_setup' variable, which exists only when facts exist. This change
uses the 'module_setup' fact to determine whether facts need to be
gathered for hosts outside of the batch. For hosts in the batch, we
switch from using the setup module to gather_facts on the play, which
can use the 'smart' gathering logic.

Change-Id: I04841fb62b2e1d9e97ce4b75ce3a7349b9c74036
Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements

commit_message:
Avoid unconditional fact gathering

One way to improve the performance of Ansible is through fact caching.
Rather than gather facts in every play, we can configure Ansible to
cache them in a persistent store. An example Ansible configuration for
doing this is as follows:

[defaults]
gathering = smart
fact_caching = jsonfile
fact_caching_connection = ./facts
fact_caching_timeout = 86400

This does not affect Kolla Ansible however, since we use the setup
module which unconditionally gathers facts regardless of the state of
the cache. This gets worse with large inventories limited to a small
batch of hosts via --limit or serial, since the limited hosts must
gather facts for all others.

One way to detect whether facts exist for a host is via the
'module_setup' variable, which exists only when facts exist. This change
uses the 'module_setup' fact to determine whether facts need to be
gathered for hosts outside of the batch. For hosts in the batch, we
switch from using the setup module to gather_facts on the play, which
can use the 'smart' gathering logic.

Change-Id: I04841fb62b2e1d9e97ce4b75ce3a7349b9c74036

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I70aec0472ce090cb54855c58f20f4f02e20ae2c2

commit_message:
Do not crash on privmsg with no content

There is a corner case (/dcc chat) where a privmsg can have no content.
Ignore such corner cases instead of crashing.

Change-Id: Ia07c76c4a2342bb4e7bc9c37a4944d4b9f18efd8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ptgbot refs/changes/84/732684/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if len(words) < 1: self.log.debug("Ignoring privmsg with no content") return

commit_message:
Fix redfish-virtual-media file permission

When not using swift with the redfish virtual media boot interface,
in other words local file storage, the file permissions for the
/httpboot/redfish folder was incorrect upon initially being created,
and new file ISOs were being created with permissions based upon the
conductor process umask value which is OS environment dependent.

Change-Id: I038ca335efa9b5443469ab8c8af12863deea0e38

This setting defaults to ``644``, ' 'or as the octal number ``0o644`` in Python. ' 'This setting must be set to the octal number ' 'representation, meaning starting with ``0o``.')),

commit_message:
Add `network_data` ironic node attribute support

Adds support for adding static network configuration to ironic node
object by adding ``network-data`` attribute to "node" osc
command.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/687910/
Change-Id: I771911cbc2cfaef2cbac841fc76971e042c010c1
Story: 2006691
Task: 37072

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I002235658290ffd494f4507dc0a6c78f94794b19

commit_message:
quota: remove FakeContext from quota unit tests

There was an unnecessary FakeContext object used in the quota unit
tests. This patch gets rid of it and derives the QuotaEngineTestCase and
BaseResourceTestCase from NoDBTestCase instead of TestCase. This cut the
runtime down for test_quota.py by 4-5 seconds.

Change-Id: I40b27c53b35b6f787144f8d7a5f2a566033dd9fb

subject: quota: remove Context.quota_class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-11-05 17:22:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/59f1baf50b184e865185e3bc64a58141454e6317', 'message': 'quota: remove Context.quota_class

While this patch does not deprecate the os-quota-classes REST API, what
it does do is move the get_quota_classes() QuotaDriver method to the
only place that uses it (the os-quota-classes API handler).

The RequestContext's quota_class attribute is entirely removed, since
this was never used outside of tests and the unused RAX turnstile
middleware. The only quota class that was ever able to be utilized was
the quota class called "default" and therefore this patch hardcodes the
quota-by-class retrieval that is done to retrieve API-modified default
quota limit values to just the 'default' quota class (yes, the
terminology here is awful. go re-read that last sentence again because
it's correct).

Now that quota classes have been removed from the QuotaDriver interface,
following patches will start to tease out the limits-specific (as
opposed to *usage-specific*) parts of the QuotaDriver interface into its
own area -- an area that will eventually be driven by oslo.limits and
Keystone's unified limits functionality.

commit_message:
quota: remove Context.quota_class

While this patch does not deprecate the os-quota-classes REST API, what
it does do is move the get_quota_classes() QuotaDriver method to the
only place that uses it (the os-quota-classes API handler).

The RequestContext's quota_class attribute is entirely removed, since
this was never used outside of tests and the unused RAX turnstile
middleware. The only quota class that was ever able to be utilized was
the quota class called "default" and therefore this patch hardcodes the
quota-by-class retrieval that is done to retrieve API-modified default
quota limit values to just the 'default' quota class (yes, the
terminology here is awful. Go re-read that last sentence again because
it's correct).

Now that quota classes have been removed from the QuotaDriver interface,
following patches will start to tease out the limits-specific (as
opposed to *usage-specific*) parts of the QuotaDriver interface into its
own area -- an area that will eventually be driven by oslo.limits and
Keystone's unified limits functionality.

Change-Id: I5ab0b6656c2dd5a2614c3958574ff91b25ebd11c

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Create separate doc/requirements.txt file and use it, this allows
to continue testing with py35 and build docs that require py36.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ic97beaec35ff633380688beb93318273ab6ca15c

commit_message:
nova: Remove configuration of '[scheduler] driver'

This option was deprecated in Ussuri [1] as nova no longer provided any
schedulers aside from the filter scheduler and the existence of
third-party schedulers was very unlikely. Stop configuring this and
simply use the default.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707225/

Change-Id: Iabdd1d00e00ee269334f0fe0db265a97207e2dc6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/05/731205/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Nova supports pluggable schedulers. The default ``FilterScheduler`` # should work in most cases. SCHEDULER=${SCHEDULER:-filter_scheduler} iniset $NOVA_CONF scheduler driver "$SCHEDULER" if [[ $SCHEDULER == "filter_scheduler" ]]; then iniset $NOVA_CONF scheduler workers "$API_WORKERS" fi

subject: quota: remove get_quota_classes() driver method
revisions:

While this patch does not deprecate the os-quota-classes API, it removes
the get_quota_classes() method from the QuotaDriver interface and places

commit_message:
quota: remove get_quota_classes() driver method

We want to deprecate the quota classes API and functionality in nova.
While this patch does not deprecate the os-quota-classes API, it removes
the get_quota_classes() method from the QuotaDriver interface and places
the quota class retrieval code in the single caller (the
os-quota-classes API handler code).

One less method cluttering up the quota driver interface.

Change-Id: I66f71a6615626326811c5fcaa7315b3dcd89f4fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/15/615615/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def get_class_quotas(self, context, resources, quota_class): """Given a list of resources, retrieve the quotas for the given quota class. :param context: The request context, for access checks. :param resources: A dictionary of the registered resources. :param quota_class: The name of the quota class to return quotas for. """ quotas = {} class_quotas = objects.Quotas.get_all_class_by_name(context, quota_class) for resource in resources.values(): quotas[resource.name] = class_quotas.get(resource.name, resource.default) return quotas def get_class_quotas(self, context, resources, quota_class): """Given a list of resources, retrieve the quotas for the given quota class. :param context: The request context, for access checks. :param resources: A dictionary of the registered resources. :param quota_class: The name of the quota class to return quotas for. """ quotas = {} for resource in resources.values(): quotas[resource.name] = -1 return quotas def get_class_quotas(self, context, quota_class): """Retrieve the quotas for the given quota class. :param context: The request context, for access checks. :param quota_class: The name of the quota class to return quotas for. """ return self._driver.get_class_quotas(context, self._resources, quota_class)

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-30 14:25:11.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'doc/requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs/commit/00c573d0d96fcbb2311aa03e540c7b38775a7cad', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Iefbde88aa089a12a34fa1243c4d626127bb2bec6
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Iefbde88aa089a12a34fa1243c4d626127bb2bec6

commit_message:
Add debug output for libvirt ping checks

This patch adds some extra debug options to the ping check. It writes
the STDOUT of ping subprocess to a temporary file which can be logged in
the debug log level.

Change-Id: Ife9a1d409a8326fb9ff07b1b04508cd11f899d10
(cherry picked from commit 674cefe1e7b8a040f955a0edb5274dafe86975f7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/91/726891/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import tempfile res = 0 with tempfile.TemporaryFile() as tfile: subprocess.check_call(ping_cmd, stdout=tfile, stderr=subprocess.STDOUT) tfile.seek(0) self.log.debug("Output from running '{0}' is: '{1}'".format (' '.join(ping_cmd), tfile.read())) except subprocess.CalledProcessError as ce: tfile.seek(0) res = ce.returncode self.log.debug("Exception from '{0}' command is: '{1}'".format (' '.join(ping_cmd), tfile.read())) tenant_id = instance_cache.get(inst_name)['tenant_id'] hostname = instance_cache.get(inst_name)['hostname'] self.log.debug("Metric value of ping check {0} is: {1}".format (' '.join(ping_cmd), res)) return (res, dims_customer_ip, dims_operations_ip, tenant_id, hostname)
deleted_lines: with open(os.devnull, "w") as fnull: res = subprocess.call(ping_cmd, stdout=fnull, stderr=fnull) tenant_id = instance_cache.get(inst_name)['tenant_id'] hostname = instance_cache.get(inst_name)['hostname'] return (res, dims_customer_ip, dims_operations_ip, tenant_id, hostname)

commit_message:
Bump version of os-images role

Version 1.9.0 of stackhpc.os-images removes the dependency
on shade and replaces it with openstacksdk.  This version
is required for python3 support.

Change-Id: If0d73e13b5922ae071671d2c7983dda6a6c5ae5e
Co-Authored-By: Sebastian Luna Valero <sebastian.luna.valero@gmail.com>
Story: 2006574
Task: 39485
